A Collection in
The Special Collections Department 5213-b

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Cocke Family Papers
1800-1871

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cocke Family Papers, Accession #5213-b, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of letters, chiefly containing family news. There is also a bill from Fisher and Bird, Norfolk, to Alexander Jackson Davis regarding the price of marble and granite; memorabilia from an 1855 tour of Europe; a bookplate of Gouverneur Morris; a photograph of the barn at "Bremo," the family estate; genealogical material; and the diaries, 1820-1842, of Louisa Maxwell Holmes Cocke.

Correspondents include William Daniel Cabell, Ann Blaws Barraud, John Hartwell Cocke, Ann Carter Oliver, Nannie Oliver, Lucy Oliver, Merit M. Robinson, Philip Barraud, and members of the Braxton family.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p:
Removed and filed in MSS 640:
Diary of Mrs. Louisa Cocke, 1820 January 2-August 9
Diary of Mrs. Louisa Cocke, 1821 December 4- 1823 December 20
Diary of Mrs. Louisa Cocke, 1825 October 18- 1826 July 4 (copy)
Diary of Mrs. Louisa Cocke, 1826 July 5- 1827 September (copy)
